div.p: The content was separated from layout. You just edit small texts now, but you will no longer see completly what you will get. In this way we get the wcms working again for you. Please feel free to adust the texts. We will try to name the small sections clearly, so you will know what you are editing currently.
Please:

ul.li: do not delete this "read me" section
and do not rename the other sections.

div.p: Both are essential working bases. There is only one exception. When you like to keep a content block, but want to move it, then you can rename the blocks you like to switch. For example: If you want to move the news from position three to position one, you only need to rename the section title:
In this way you dont get confused which slot you have to rename, when you have 6 News-SLot-One. Of couse you have to do it for all languages.
It is also important to:

ul.li: keep the html structure of the content.

div.p: At best you only edit existing texts without adding or removing whole elements, like headlines or paragraphs.
Good luck :P

Die digitale Publikationsplattform perspectivia.net ist ein internationales, epochenübergreifendes und interdisziplinäres Portal für geisteswissenschaftliche Publikationen. Als Teil der Forschungsinfrastruktur der Max Weber Stiftung - Deutsche Geisteswissenschaftliche Institute im Ausland werden hier von den Instituten und ihren Kooperationspartnern herausgegebene Publikationen und Forschungsdaten frei zugänglich gemacht. Die Max Weber Stiftung ist den Prinzipien des Open Access verpflichtet und begleitet die Transformation der Geisteswissenschaften in Richtung einer offenen Wissenschaft.

The publication platform perspectivia.net sees itself as an international, epoch-spanning and interdisciplinary portal for digital publications in the humanities. This infrastructure of the Max Weber Foundation - German Humanities Institutes Abroad provides free access to publications by the institutes and their cooperation partners. The Max Weber Foundation is committed to the principles of Open Access, thus perspectivia.net promotes free access to knowledge and accompanies the transformation of the humanities towards an open science.

La plateforme de publication électronique perspectivia.net se veut un portail international, interdisciplinaire et historique pour les publications en sciences humaines. L'infrastructure de la Fondation Max Weber - Instituts allemands de sciences humaines à l'étranger - rend ainsi les publications des différents instituts et de leurs partenaires librement accessibles en ligne. La Fondation Max Weber s'engage à respecter les principes de l’Open Acces et perspectivia.net promeut le libre accès au savoir et accompagne l’évolution des sciences humaines vers une science ouverte.
